activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr.

records.addlTxt:
3:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. 
ADA calls witness Detective Derrik Maye, sworn and examined.
Identifies Deft.
Atty Reabe cross-examines.
ADA redirects.
ADA provides argument.
Atty Reabe opposes bind over w/o argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.
Court schedules with parties. 
4:11 pm
Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:06 AM Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court heard on motion filed.
Atty Zoellner heard and argues the reasons of the motion to Dismiss the Complaint.
ADA argues.
Court heard and denies motion.
10:27 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:50 PM Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mckenzie Christiansen in court for Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Christiansen has no objection

8:52 AM Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - contacted the PD's office and was told he qualified but they had a conflict.
Atty Zoellner is present and is heard.
Would take the case, pending a conflict.
ADA provides a copy of the complaint.
9:00 off record.
9:01 back on record.
Atty Zoellner heard and believes he can represent.
Requests more time to meet with deft.
Court schedules.
9:01 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:36 AM Defendant Bruce Anthony Cassady Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail appears for bond purposes only.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Court heard and imposes $20,00 cash bond w/ conditions, sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances and including THC w/o a valid RX, no contact with C.R. or known drug users or sellers.
Court schedules with parties.
11:41 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
